11.content:
Morgan stood next to the girl’s parents, looking down as the casket was lowered into the grave while the parents looked on. The mother held on to her husband, both of them struggling to fight back the tears, as they were saying their last goodbyes to their fourteen year-old daughter Cindy, whose body was being lowered into the ground. Morgan couldn’t imagine what it must be like for them, to lose their only daughter to a stupid drunk driver, who ran over their daughter that fateful night, just a few nights back, at the end of that party. He couldn’t even look at them, that’s how terrible he felt.

Morgan was fifteen years old and he was just a freshman in high school. He had met Cindy since the beginning of the school year, since he sat right next to her from the very first class period on the first day of school. He liked the girl a lot because she was into the same kinds of music as he was, since she looked over his iPod and she remarked that she liked his musical taste. Right away, the two clicked. Morgan and Cindy always walked together, they ate together and they studied together. Finally, they had this school party that night, and they went to the dance.

The party was over at midnight, and Cindy was about to cross the street to walk over to a friend’s car, when a car pulled up out of nowhere and struck her just as she had crossed the street. She was hit while she was in the middle of the road, and the person who struck her just continued driving. Someone called the police and got the license plate, reporting the incident as a hit-and-run. The police got after the car, and they arrested the driver later on for driving under the influence. Meanwhile, an ambulance was called in, and Cindy was rushed to the hospital, where she died of internal bleeding several hours later.

Cindy was a popular girl in school. She played volleyball and soccer, and she had known Morgan from the soccer team as well. Cindy also played in the band and she was in all of Morgan’s classes. She was close friends with several of the other girls, and even a few of the guys, although Morgan was her closest boyfriend at the time. Not only that, but the two teens had found out that Morgan and Cindy only lived a few blocks away from one another. That made things really convenient, and Morgan actually spent the night once at Cindy’s house, where he stayed up late just to watch a movie with her.

Morgan was tall and skinny with short, spikey black hair and blue eyes while Cindy was short and athletic was short blonde hair which was tied together with a ponytail in the back and she had blue eyes as well. Cindy loved to hang out with Morgan and they just started to date one another regularly when Cindy got hit in the accident, and Morgan was just now beginning to come to grips with the loss of his first and only girlfriend.

When the funeral was over, Morgan quietly went back home and he changed clothes. He put on his shorts and t-shirt, and he lay on his bed. He dozed off for a few minutes, when he woke up with a start. For a moment he thought he had heard Cindy’s faint voice speaking to him from his bedroom…

111.content:
“Morgan…. Morgan!”

Morgan just turned on his bed as he heard a faint voice calling out his name repeatedly.

Finally, he opened his eyes and glanced around the room.

“Who… Who’s there?”

“Morgan… Help me…”

“Cindy?”

“Help me… I need your help…”

Morgan was startled when he recognized the girl’s voice. Was that Cindy?

“Cindy? That can’t be you! You’re dead!”

“Morgan… You gotta help me!”

Suddenly, a faint, white figure appeared standing in the center of the room. The figure was transparent and had pale, white skin. It was wearing a dress and long stockings with nice dress shoes. It looked like a girl with a pony tail and with blue eyes. It almost hovered above the carpet as it stood in the center of the bedroom, facing the bed that Morgan was sleeping on.

“Holy crap!” Morgan gasped, as he saw that strange figure before him. “A… A ghost!”

“Morgan… It’s me…” the ghostly figure said calmly.

Morgan slowly stood up and walked up to the figure, staring at it in complete disbelief. Yes, it was Cindy… Or, her ghost!

“Cindy! Oh, Cindy! You’re alive!” Morgan stuttered.

“I wish I could affirm that, Morg…” she said sadly. “However, I do bring some good news…”

“What is that?”

“I died before my time… Which is why I’m walking on the earth again as a spirit… I’m a lost soul without a physical body… But, the bad news is that I can’t stay in this form for long… I will disappear soon if I don’t find a body to stay in very soon!” Cindy explained.

“Say what?”

“Can I use your body, Morgan?” she asked, as she walked up to him. “I need a place to live!”

“You mean, inside of me?”

“Yes!”

“Sure, Cindy… I mean… That way, we’ll always be together, right?” Morgan wondered out loud.

“You got it!” Cindy smiled.

Then Cindy walked right up to Morgan and she continued walking until her body walked straight into his body… Cindy’s body then disappeared into Morgan’s body and she disappeared from view for the last time… ever.

“Cindy? Where are you?” Morgan asked.

“I’m right here, Morgan… Inside of you!” Cindy’s voice spoke, coming from Morgan’s mouth.

“Wow! I feel it… I feel you inside of me! This is amazing!” Morgan exclaimed, as he realized that Cindy had moved in to his body… permanently.

Cindy spoke up next, using Morgan’s mouth. Morgan just loved the fact that he had a girl living inside of him, because that meant that he always had someone to talk to. He was never alone and Cindy was always with him, trapped inside of his body.

“Well, technically, Morgan, John asked me out, so we don’t have to plan anything. I just get to use your body, so you’re going along for the ride!” Cindy responded.

Morgan just let out a deep sigh.

“Yeah, I guess…”

“It’s easier than explaining to everyone that you’re permanently possessed by a dead girl!”

“Uhh… Very true!”

Just at that moment, the doorbell rang! Morgan got up and ran towards the front door, opening it right away and seeing John standing before him holding a small bouquet of flowers.

“Hey John!” Morgan said. “Come in!”

John stared at Morgan for a moment, before clearing his throat.

“Hey Morgan… Umm… No offense but… Can I talk to Cindy?” John asked cautiously. “I know you two share the same body together…”

Suddenly, Cindy’s voice began to speak out of Morgan’s mouth, even though Morgan’s lips were moving. It looked funny hearing a girl’s voice coming out of a boy’s mouth.

“Ohhhh John! Look at those flowers! They are so pretty!” Cindy said, as she allowed Morgan to reach out and gently take the flowers out of John’s hands. “Hold on! Let me put them in water right away!”

John just stood there, waiting patiently as Morgan ran into the kitchen, holding the flowers. He found an empty vase and filled it with water. Then he placed the flowers in it, rearranging them neatly, before placing the vase on the kitchen table. John knew for sure that there was no way Morgan could act this way on his own. He was totally controlled by Cindy! John had never seen Morgan act so girly before!

“Okay, John!” Cindy said, speaking through Morgan. “Where do you want to go?”

“Well, you can pick between going out for dinner, going to a movie, or going dancing! I figured you certainly wanted to have dinner with me, right?” John grinned.

“Ohh John, you got it!” Cindy cheered, making Morgan’s hands clasp together out of happiness.

“Great! Now, after dinner, would you like to go to a movie, and then we can go to my house afterwards? Or, do you want to go dancing? Of course, we can always go to my place afterwards!” John said with a huge grin on his face.

Cindy had to think hard for a moment. Going to the movies in Morgan’s body was fun, of course. Now, going dancing in Morgan’s body was a blast as well, because then it would be like John dancing with Morgan! Which would she pick?

Slowly Mandy moved her left foot and to her surprise she saw Jessie's foot doing the same.

"Mandy, is it working? My foot just moved on it's own." Jessie asked scared as she felt a strange tingling going through her leg.

"It worked alright. Now the next." As Mandy moved her right leg within Jessie's right leg she saw how her other leg was absorbed and could be moved.

"Alright, now the next part." Mandy let herself lie down with her torso into Jessie's torso, making sure her head wasn't touching Jessie's head yet. Both girls could feel the shivering happening. Next thing Jessie felt how her fingers moved gently touching the sheets of her bed.

"It works. It really works." Jessie said happy to the back of Mandy's head.

"I know. Now the next thing." Mandy told Jessie as she tried to look back but couldn't. Jessie could see Mandy's large and fluffy hair covering her face and then the next thing happened as her head began shaking uncontrollably. Jessie could feel Mandy's spirit being absorbed into her body. The pressure was so much that her eyes rolled in the back of her head and she felt unconscious.

Who wakes up?
155321.title: A friend's funeral.

155322.content:
"I'm so late." Penny sighted as she arrived at Dawn's house. She just got a text an hour ago where Dawn invited her to spend the night at her home. Penny didn't mind staying the night, but her mother thought something else about it. Her mother didn't like Dawn at all. The reason for it was because Dawn and her family were different than they were. Penny's family considered themselves to be a normal average family, but Dawn and her family were free spirited. They didn't believe in curfews and rules. Everyone was free to do what they wanted to do. They were much seen at protests, protesting against anything that would limit their freedom. Penny longed for such freedom, but sadly she had to deal with her own life as it was. Luckily her mother caved in to let Penny go as she pointed out it was Friday night and she didn't had any school the next morning. Perhaps she could stay at Dawn's life the next day as well. It was family game night, Penny shuddered at the thought her little sister whining when she lost a game. Her parents always let Amber win, what was the point of it if you weren't allowed to win.

Penny took a step forward noticing the weeds sticking out from between the stones. Just like everything else, Dawn's family didn't bother to take care of the garden. Once in a few weeks Dawn's mom, or Elena as she liked to be called by Penny would mow it using a handheld mower, telling her it was cleaner and was great for muscle building. Penny then knocked on the door. She heard steps coming from down the stairs and when the door opened it was Dawn standing there. She had long brown hair reaching her bottom, big brown eyes who could look at you quizzically and a smile that was always there.

"Hey Penny, glad you could make it." Dawn held out her arms and gave Penny a big hug. Penny hugged Dawn back immediately smelling the flowery shampoo Dawn usually used.

"Yeah, me as well." Penny admitted as she was led through.

"Did the masters allowed you to leave?" Dawn asked referring to Penny's parents.

"Yes, well my mom actually. I'm so glad dad wasn't home. I wouldn't be allowed to leave forever." Penny complained as she went up the stairs. She then noticed something.

"Hey, your mom, I mean Elena not home?" Penny asked confused. Dawn shook her head.

"No, Elena wanted to go out with some friends." Dawn explained.

"So that means we're alone at home. You really have an amazing mom, Dawn." Penny moaned.

"I wish, big sis is still at home." Dawn pointed to her sister's room. "She's got a friend with her as well, so that's why I invited you."

"River didn't mind then?" Penny asked. River was Dawn's older sister.

"Why would she?" Dawn asked to which Penny shrugged. River was like a copy of Dawn though she did care a bit more about her looks.

"And why are you carrying that?" Dawn asked all of a sudden referring to the sleeping bag Penny was holding.

"Well, I usually do when I go to a sleepover." Penny explained confused. Penny waved it away. "No way, that would be really cold. We're going to sleep in my bed. That way we can share our heat." Dawn explained.

"O-okay." Penny agreed as they stepped inside Dawn's room. Penny looked around the room. She hadn't been here before. It was like something Penny expected from someone like Dawn. The room was painted green, though not very well as the few blotches of pink paint told her. Clothes were hanging around, even some of Dawn's underwear. If Penny's mom saw this she would have a stroke for sure.

"So, this is my room. I hope you like it." Dawn told her as she lied down on her bed.

"It's...great. Really you." Penny told Dawn as she looked around and noticed a snake lying in an aquarium. "Oh that's Charles, he's harmless." Dawn explained casually.

"Wow." Penny said taking a closer look at him. The snake looked at her with curious eyes. Penny quickly looked the other way were Dawn was rummaging through the drawers of her desk.

"So what do we do? Talk about boys or watch a movie?" Penny asked nervously as she wasn't sure what Dawn was into.

"I was thinking about checking this out." Dawn produced a pendant with a crystal inside it.

"Wow, where did you get that?" Penny asked as she let go off her stuff and checked it out.

"A week ago, my aunt passed away. She left me this pendant. When I got it, it had a note on it saying it had mystical powers. So I thought we could go check it out."

"Neat, but why me exactly?" Penny asked. "I mean, we know each other from school, but don't you want to check this out with some other friends of yours?" Penny asked. The reason Penny and Dawn knew each other was because of a science project they did a few months ago.

Dawn suddenly grabbed Penny's hand. "Because I like you Penny. I really do and I thought we could become friends if we check it out together." Dawn simply stated with a friendly smile. Penny was touched by it somehow. Dawn was really weird, but it was what made her friendly as well.

"I'd like that too Dawn." Penny agreed giving a nervous smile back. "So, I think one of us has to put it on." Penny stated looking at the pendant.

Who was going to wear the pendant?
155322.title: Scenario 2.

info.brief_description: What if a boy shares his body with a girl? Or a girl is possessed by a boy? Please add!
info.description:
This interactive contains a collection of stories involving the following:
-a girl merges her soul with a living teenage boy
-a boy merges his soul with a living teenage girl
-one boy merges his soul with another teenage boy
-one girl merges her soul with another teenage girl

So, basically, two (or more) people would be living inside of one body.

We can have characters where a boy is possessed by a girl, so his body can be partially controlled by a girl. This girl can speak through his voice, she can see what he sees, she can use his hands, arms and legs, and she has full usage of all his senses. The opposite can also happen, where a girl is possessed by a boy, and this girl feels the boy's presence inside of her.

This usually happens when the boy is possessed by another boy or girl who is a spirit or a ghost, from someone who might have passed away previously. This is the most common scenario.

Another possibility is that through magic, or through some scientific experiment gone wrong, someone loses their physical shape and is forced to live inside of another person's body in order to survive.

I prefer the scenarios where:
-A boy is possessed by a girl
-A girl is possessed by a boy

But other cases are also acceptable where a boy is possessed by another boy, or a girl is possessed by another girl.

Please keep all characters in the age range between ages 6 and 18, since this is a teen-related story. This is especially for the characters who are being possessed by others.

Lastly:
-No one-line chapters
-Chapters of less than 100 words will be deleted at the owner's discretion
-No vore
-No severe foul language
-Keep it clean
-Please check spelling and grammar
-300 GP's for chapters of 300 words or more which follow all rules and are written in proper English.
-Have FUN!
info.pretty_title: One Teen Body with More Souls
